name: Laurel County Agency for Substance Abuse Policy (ASAP)
description: Local substance abuse prevention organization established in 2000 as part of Kentucky's Agency for Substance Abuse Policy (ASAP) network. Focuses on reducing alcohol, tobacco, and other drug use among youth and adults through evidence-based education, prevention programs, and community collaboration. Provides educational programs to schools and partners with local agencies to create cohesive prevention initiatives.
source: Verified from official Laurel County ASAP website and multiple authoritative sources
eligibility: Open to all Laurel County residents
services: Substance abuse prevention education, youth programs, community outreach, drug take-back initiatives, family support programs, school-based prevention programs
notes: Board Coordinator: Christie Shrader. Part of statewide KY-ASAP network with over 100 local boards. Provides 4-5 programs monthly to area schools. Works with Kentucky Office of Drug Control Policy.
